New Records: Nikola Jokic recorded a triple-double with 23 points, 20 rebounds, and 16 assists, joining Russell Westbrook as the second player since Wilt Chamberlain to achieve a 20/20/15 game
Key Match Events: The Nuggets trailed by two early in the fourth quarter before Russell Westbrook converted a three-point play, Michael Porter Jr. sank a 3-pointer, and Westbrook added another basket as the Nuggets went ahead 103-99.
Denver missed nine consecutive shots and didn’t score for 4:08 while the Thunder reeled off the next seven points to go up 106-103.
Peyton Watson split a pair of free throws, Michael Porter Jr. made a layup, and Porter hit from deep to put the Nuggets back in front 109-108.
Michael Porter Jr. and Peyton Watson sank 3-pointers, and Julian Strawther had a putback dunk during an 11-5 run that gave Denver a 123-115 lead.
Jalen Williams scored five straight to make it 123-120 entering the final minute.
Nikola Jokic split a pair of free throws with 27 seconds left, Shai Gilgeous-Alexander made a layup, and Peyton Watson missed two foul shots, leaving Oklahoma City within two.
Peyton Watson blocked Shai Gilgeous-Alexander’s last-second floater to preserve the win.
Pre-Game Insights: The Nuggets played without Jamal Murray (concussion protocol) for the third straight game and without Aaron Gordon, who will miss multiple weeks due to a right calf strain.
The Thunder had opened with seven straight wins.
Post-Match Reflections: Nikola Jokic and Russell Westbrook had unreal performances in the Nuggets' win.
The Nuggets ended a four-game head-to-head losing streak against the Oklahoma City Thunder.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Thunder led 66-55 at halftime, but the Nuggets used a 40-point third quarter to storm back.
The Nuggets trailed 95-95 entering the fourth quarter but managed to pull ahead.
The Thunder's Jalen Williams had 29 points, 10 rebounds, and nine assists.
